title: Wealth Taxes Don’t Work. Here’s Why.
text:
“Let me tell you about the very rich. They are different from you and me,” F. Scott Fitzgerald wrote. To which his contemporary, Ernest Hemingway, would retort years later, “Yes, they have more money.”

This difference these days is referred to as inequality, which of course figures prominently in today’s politics. This week’s Democratic debate displayed that in spades, with potential presidential candidates proffering measures to narrow the difference between Fitzgerald’s very rich and presumably just about everybody else...
description: Levies like those espoused by Bernie Sanders and Elizabeth Warren cost some European economies more than they raised. That’s why so many countries have abandoned them.
